acute_aquatic_toxicity.hazard_name: Hazardous to the aquatic environment Acute
acute_aquatic_toxicity.rationale: Since its 48h-EC50 = 0.73 mg/L for crustaceans (Daphinia magna) (AQUIRE, 2008), the substance was classified into Category 1.

acute_toxicity_dermal.rationale: Based on its rabbit LD = 880 mg/kg (IUCLID (2000)), the substance was classified into Category 3.

acute_toxicity_inhalation_dust.hazard_name: Acute toxicity Inhalation: Dusts and mists
acute_toxicity_inhalation_dust.rationale: Although it is reported that its rat LC50 > 0.097 mg/L (16.4 ppmV) (HSDB (2006)), classification is not possible only on this datum. As relevant information, since its saturated vapour pressure concentration was 0.36 ppmV, which was below 16.4 ppmV, the substance was considered as mist.

acute_toxicity_oral.rationale: Since among its rat LD50 values of 2380 mg/kg (young males) (HSDB (2006)), 1870 mg/kg (old males) (HSDB (2006)), 2590 mg/kg (HSDB (2006)), and 2400 mg/kg (IUCLID (2000)), many of them are equivalent to the guidance value of "Not classified", the substance was classified into "Not classified" in JIS classification (Category 5 in UN classification).

chronic_aquatic_toxicity.hazard_name: Hazardous to the aquatic environment Long-term
chronic_aquatic_toxicity.rationale: Although its preexisting classification for acute toxicity is Category 1, it is rapidly biodegradable (readily biodegradable (Biodegradation and Bioconcentration of Existing Chemical Substances under the Chemical Substances Control Law, 1977)), and it is estimated to have low bioaccumulation potency (log Kow = 2.85 (SRC, 2005)), and therefore, the substance was classified into "Not classified".

corrosive_to_metals.rationale: Test methods applicable to solid substances are not available.

explosives.rationale: There are no chemical groups associated with explosive properties present in the molecules.

flammable_gases.hazard_name: Flammable gases including chemically unstable gases

germ_cell_mutagenicity.rationale: Since there is no available in vivo test data, and there are no available test results of in vitro mutagenicity tests, classification is not possible.

organic_peroxides.rationale: Organic compounds containing no bivalent -O-O- structure in the molecule

oxidizing_solids.rationale: The substance contains oxygen (but not fluorine or chlorine) which is chemically bonded only to carbon or hydrogen.

pyrophoric_solids.rationale: Its autoignition point is 541.7degC (HSDB (2006)), which is above 70degC.

reproductive_toxicity.rationale: In a developmental test with oral administration during the organogenetic period of rats, at doses showing parental body weight decrease, no developmental aberration in offspring was observed. But, the test did not provide data on parental sexual functions and fertility. Therefore, due to the lack of data, classification is not possible.

self_heating_substances.rationale: Test methods applicable to solid (melting point <= 140degC) substances are not available. (96degC, Merck (14th, 2006))

self_reactive_substances.rationale: There are no chemical groups present in the molecule associated with explosive or self-reactive properties.

serious_eye_damage_irritation.rationale: Since it is reported that in a test using rabbits, scarring of cornea and conjunctiva was noted (HSDB (2006)), in a rabbit standard Draize test, the substance was severely irritating (RTECS (2006)). Furthermore, it is rated Xi; R41 in the EU classification, therefore, the substance was classified into Category 1.

skin_corrosion_irritation.hazard_statement: Causes severe skin burns and eye damage
skin_corrosion_irritation.rationale: Since in a skin dermal irritation test using rabbits, moderate to severe erythem and edema were noted after 72 hours (irritation score of 7.09/8.00) (HSDB (2006)), the substance was classified into Category 1.

substances_mixtures_emit_flammable_gas_i.hazard_name: Substances and mixtures which, in contact with water, emit flammable gases
substances_mixtures_emit_flammable_gas_i.rationale: The chemical structure of the substance does not contain metals or metalloids (B, Si, P, Ge, As, Se, Sn, Sb, Te, Bi, Po, At).

systemic_toxicity_repeat_exposure.hazard_name: Specific target organ toxicity - Repeated exposure
systemic_toxicity_repeat_exposure.rationale: In a rat oral administration test for 13 weeks, at the dose of 400 mg/kg, which is above the guidance value, squamous hyperplasia and hyperkeratosis of the nonglandular stomach were noted, and the NOAEL was 130 mg/kg, which is above the guidance value of Category 2 (HSDB (2006)). However, since there is no other available information for classifying into "Not classified", and due to the lack of data, the substance was classified into "Classification not possible".

systemic_toxicity_single_exposure.hazard_name: Specific target organ toxicity - Single exposure
systemic_toxicity_single_exposure.rationale: Since it is documented that in an oral administration test using mice, at the dose of 500 mg/kg equivalent to the guidance value of Category 2, in the kidney, degeneration of the distal tubular epithelium, papillary necrosis, and tubular dilation were noted, and in the stomach, there were vascular congestion and acute inflammatory cell infiltration (HSDB (2006)), the substance was classified into Category 2 (kidney). As relevant information, the inflammatory degeneration in the stomach was considered to be caused by irritation of the substance, and was not evaluated.
